qas.question: Where is the Centro Cultural Universitario?
The CCU holds, in addition to a music theater, what?
The former Ministry of Foreign Affairs had a cultural center opened in what year?
What is the name of the CCU center opened in 2007?

context: The Centro Nacional de las Artes (National Center for the Arts has several venues for music, theatre, dance. <a0_0>UNAM's main campus<a0_0/>, also in the southern part of the city, is home to the Centro Cultural Universitario (the University Culture Center) (CCU). The CCU also houses the <a1_0>National Library<a1_0/>, the interactive Universum, Museo de las Ciencias, the Sala Nezahualcóyotl concert hall, several theatres and cinemas, and the new University Museum of Contemporary Art (MUAC). A branch of the National University's CCU cultural center was inaugurated in <a2_0>2007<a2_0/> in the facilities of the former Ministry of Foreign Affairs, known as <a3_0>Tlatelolco<a3_0/>, in <a4_0>north-central Mexico City<a4_0/>.
